diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Cerebellar degeneration and myeloneuropathy due to vitamin E and copper deficiencies
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis was made based on the patient's long-standing celiac disease leading to prolonged micronutrient malabsorption, evidenced by low serum vitamin E and copper levels, neurological symptoms (gait unsteadiness, leg stiffness), and supporting imaging findings of cerebellar atrophy.
